# Linear combination question

Consider a random variable $X$ with 

$$
\E[X] = \mu \text{ and } \var(X) = \sigma^2, 
$$

and let

$$
Y = a + bX
$$

## Part a

Calculate $\E[Y]$.

MARKS: 1

SOLUTION

$$
\begin{aligned}
\E[Y] &= \E[a + bX]\\
& = a + b\E[X]\\
& = a + b\mu.
\end{aligned}
$$

END

## Part b

Calculate $\var(Y)$.

MARK: 2

SOLUTION

$$
\begin{aligned}
\var[Y] &= \var[a + bX]\\
& = b^2\var[X]\\
& = b^2\sigma^2.
\end{aligned}
$$

END
